description.short: The UK's premier Red Kite feeding station, where hundreds of these magnificent raptors gather daily for a spectacular aerial display.
description.full:
Gigrin Farm is a small family-run farm in the heart of Mid Wales, now world-famous as the UK's official Red Kite Feeding Centre. Located just half a mile from the market town of Rhayader, overlooking both the Wye and Elan Valleys, the farm attracts between 300 and 600 wild Red Kites every single day for a truly breathtaking spectacle that has been running since 1992.

The feeding station was established following a request from the RSPB when Red Kites were on the verge of extinction in the UK. Founder Eithel Powell began feeding the birds daily, and over three decades later, the Kites have thrived and are no longer endangered. The farm has played a pivotal role in one of conservation's greatest success stories. Visitors can watch from comfortable general hides or specialist photographic hides positioned just metres from where the Kites feed.

The Red Kite Centre offers a complete visitor experience with a coffee shop serving homemade cakes and refreshments, a gift shop, picnic site, and scenic farm walk. The farm is particularly special as it's home to several rare leucistic (white) Red Kites - there are thought to be only around 10 in the world, and three visit Gigrin regularly. As Simon King from Springwatch put it: "For Red Kites like you've probably never seen them before" - this is truly a world-class wildlife experience.
